top_categories.workout_context: Rasputitsa's Vermont Class 4 roads (unmaintained dirt), Mud (guaranteed forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 46 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Rasputitsa's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before April.
46 miles on Vermont Class 4 roads—unmaintained dirt, mud burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Rasputitsa, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
At Rasputitsa, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
5,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
109ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on Vermont Class 4 roads—unmaintained dirt, mud. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
5,000ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
Base fitness for Rasputitsa. Without this, the hard workouts break you down instead of building you up.
Smooth pedaling at 46 miles saves muscle. Bad technique at mile 10 is invisible. At mile 80 it's a cramp.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Rasputitsa. Train it until it feels boring.

race_overlay.heat: April in Burke, Vermont — 35-55°F, 40% rain chance, mud guaranteed. 'Rasputitsa' = Russian for 'mud season'. Begin heat acclimatization 10–14 days before Rasputitsa — 20–30min sauna sessions or midday rides in full kit. Pre-load sodium 48 hours out. Target 500–750ml/hr with electrolytes on race day.
race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Rasputitsa’s 46 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Rasputitsa demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride vermont class 4 roads—unmaintained dirt, mud at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: vermont class 4 roads (unmaintained dirt), mud (guaranteed in april), technical climbs. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 46 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and Durability to prepare you for 46 miles of vermont class 4 roads—unmaintained dirt, mud in Burke, Vermont.
